intro: Erysimum orientale, commonly known as the oriental wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has linear, hairy leaves and produces long, slender seed pods that mature in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
